title: Ticket #3245: fix/update MPI submit script for SL6
description:
There isn't currently a working script for SL6.

There is some urgency to getting this working by November 2012 so that LIGO-India can evaluate Condor for use on their clusters (which have non-LIGO MPI users).

2012-Oct-26 09:52:08 by samf:
The OpenMPI script works just fine. I used a Hello World code (with an executable called mpi_hw) and used the default openmpiscript 

#############################################
##   submit description file for a parallel program
#############################################
universe = parallel
executable = openmpiscript
getenv=true
arguments = mpi_hw
#actual_mpi_job arg1 arg2 arg3

should_transfer_files = yes
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit_or_evict

transfer_input_files = mpi_hw

output = o.$(NODE)
error  = e.$(NODE)
log    = l

notification = never
machine_count = 2
queue

For MPICH2, I used version 1.5. I tried using MPICH2 Version 1.2.1 and had lots of trouble. That said, 1.2.1 is 2.5-3 years old already. I had to make two changes to the file mp1script for me to get it to work. Both involved changing some flags. sort no longer recognizes certain old school flags (+0) and nor does mpirun recognize the -v flag. 

#Old code
sort -n +0 < $CONDOR_CONTACT_FILE | awk '{print $2}' > machines

#New code
sort -n -k 1 < $CONDOR_CONTACT_FILE | awk '{print $2}' > machines


#Old code
mpirun -v -np $_CONDOR_NPROCS -machinefile machines $EXECUTABLE $@

#New code
mpirun -np $_CONDOR_NPROCS -machinefile machines $EXECUTABLE $@

2013-Jan-28 14:53:36 by samf:
I heard back from Vivien.

Juan Barayoga at Caltech gave me a solution that worked.

1. Copy .ssh/id_rsa.pub to .ssh/authorized_keys

2. Create .ssh/config: $ cat config Host * StrictHostKeyChecking no

with this, I successfully submitted jobs with openmpiscript.

2013-Sep-11 17:56:45 by gthain:
Working with the cluster at Caltech, I was able to reproduce a problem, but it didn't look like the same error message.

I've put my work in ~gthain/partest on ldas-pcdev1

First, I build an MPI program with my favorite passing a token around a ring example, ring.c. Note that the mpicc doesn't statically link the mpi libraries, so you need to set an rpath in order for it to work reliably: 

PATH=/usr/lib64/openmpi/bin:$PATH
mpicc -Wl,-rpath /usr/lib64/openmpi/lib -o ring ring.c

One difference between Caltech and the UW cluster is that caltech does not use slot users, and it does have a shared filesystem. This caused me some surprises with openmpi, but, by putting the binary in the shared filesystem, which is really what openmpi wants, my tests ran. 

$ cp ring ~/ring
$ cp /usr/share/doc/condor-8.0.2/etc/examples/openmpiscript .
$ cat parsubmit
universe = parallel
executable = openmpiscript
arguments = /home/gthain/ring

getenv = true

should_transfer_files = yes
transfer_input_files = /home/gthain/ring
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit

output = output.$(NODE)
error  = error.$(NODE)

log = log
machine_count = 4
queue

$ condor_submit parsubmit
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 59449841.
